author: jwasinger
content: I want to add comments to some yul code I am writing for a test case using execution-spec-tests.  What's the proper way to write a `//` in the python format string

author: jwasinger
content: have tried escaping them (`\/\/`) but that doesn't work

author: spencer_tb
content: I usually use  `//`  for example within the yul snippet of this testcase: https://github.com/ethereum/execution-spec-tests/blob/main/tests/homestead/yul/test_yul_example.py#L29-L38

author: spencer_tb
content: And for f-strings this example might help using `Template`: https://github.com/ethereum/execution-spec-tests/pull/54/files#diff-6e7069ab173e2db0e414caf88ab7e0191a4cd5def3ae76cf7a3bc24d59569e44R218-R242
